page.title: 10BRIDGES ACROSS THE ESK
page.content: {TOWNHEAD BRIDGE}JOINS THE OLDTOWN TO THE NEWTOWN OF LANGHOLM.IT HAS 3 ARCHES AND WAS BUILT IN 1775 BY{ROBIN {HOTSON}.ON THE BRIDGE THERE IS A MARK CARVED IN THE STONE WHICH HAS A TRIANGLE SHAPE AND A LINE ABOVE WITH A CROSS ON THE TOP.THIS WAS {THOMAS {TELFORD'S }MARK AND WAS MADE BY HIM WHEN HE WAS AN APPRENTICE WORKING ON THE BRIDGE.HE LATER BECAME A FAMOUS ENGINEER. THE {SUSPENSION BRIDGE }IS A FOOTBRIDGE MADE IN 1871.IT COLLAPSED DURING ITS OPENING CEREMONY BUT LUCKILY NOBODY WAS KILLED BECAUSE THE RIVER WAS LOW AT THE TIME.IT WAS RE_BUILT AND IS STILL IN REGULAR USE. {SKIPPER'S BRIDGE }WAS BUILT IN 1693 AND WAS FINISHED IN 1700.IT SPANS THE ESK ON THE A7 SOUTH OF LANGHOLM.
